intro: Othonna dinteri, commonly known as the Dinter's othonna, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant features a compact, cushion-like growth habit with dense, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hair. It produces small, yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. Othonna dinteri is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-drained soil.
